reviews.review_msg: A lot of people need to understand that this class is an intro class which means there is going to be a lot of material. Depending on how you study and how often you study is 100% going to affect your mark. The material itself isn't hard, there is just a lot. Mike's lectures go by pretty quickly with his enthusiasm and dad jokes.
Great guy tbh. Class isnt easy but it is very easy to follow and hard to get left behind.
screwed the whole class by giving ridiculous questions on midterm...

Prof Walsh was fantastic. He taught everything from his notes, and clarified quickly if something wasn't understood. He was mostly approachable, and had plenty of interesting stories which he shared in lecture. Labs were fun, and I would suggest buying the anatomy colouring book. Silly, but an easy way to learn.

straight up...bad prof. his lectures are almost useless to go to because he doesn't really review the notes too much; only talks about how awesome he is. on top of that, he expects you to know every detail of his notes. the labs were fun though and the TA's were great. the class would be great...with another prof

The labs are easily the best part of this course as they are childishly easy but quite fun. Focus on memorization for all exams. Attend his lectures for diagrams he draws, but don't expect to be stimulated apart from his somehwat-funny-at-times jokes. Notes are point by point in a Word document - more or less random facts put together. As for the p

worst teacher ever. I have never given a prof a bad eval, but he deserved it. Does not like to teach which is quite clear as he ends class early all the time(great if you want to pay and not get anything...) tests were unfair but labs were fun as the TAs were great. Avoid this teacher he'll make you quite Kin

this guy is a a horrible professor, i dont know how hes still teaching. his exams barley make sense, and his notes are useless, in every lecture he just goes over irrelevant facts from the notes, and usually talks about his own life stories

he is extremely easy, all you need to do is study is notes and you'll do fine. I got an A, his lectures are very interesting. If you're good at memorizing you'll do fine, and there is no need for you to by the text book.

Study the notes he gives and you'll get an A on the midterms and final. Adds interesting stories to lectures. Do not buy the textbook, he supplements all course information using his own notes, which he posts online. Interesting course, easy teaching style, good prof overall.

This class is highly interesting and professor Walsh adds in nice anecdotes to accompany the material. The exams are straight out of the notes, but dont think you can skip class because he will add some diagrams he draws during lecture.

Very straight forward. Expects the answers to be word for word from his notes so just study that and you'll be fine. Pretty funny guy and does play favorites, esoecially if you're into sports and Halo. Overall, not bad.

Easy course w/ minimal work. Just study his notes exactly and there should be no guess work on the exam. Very straight forward exams. He has funny stories to tell which is quite the motivation to attend lectures; however, attending lectures are not required given that it is available via mySFU.

he's slightly creepy and pervy. i agree his lectures are pretty interesting with additional info but exams straight out of his notes. he loves his graphs! not to mention, stupid little details and not the big picture.
THIS GUY IS A JERKMASTER! HE SUCKS AND I DIDNT LIKE HIS CLASS BECAUSE IT IS A JOKECITY!
Love his lectures. Not a hard course. Lots of materials to know and memorize, but otherwise  clear. It was fun being in the class. I especially enjoyed 375, in class though.

The professor was a good at explaining the notes. The notes are available online. His tests are strictly from his notes. Lots of memorization for tests. His tests are short answer for the most part. He isn't available outside of class, but tutorial was very helpful.

Prof. Walsh is definitely concerned with memorizing details rather than learning concepts. I found his lecture syle engaging, but he didn't use the text at all, and all 4 (thats right, 3 midterms) exams came straight from his lecture notes. A photographic memory would really help you in this course.
No Comments
Physiology by numbers.  Memorize everything.  His teaching style is good and his notes are straight-forward.  His tests, although anal, are fair.
good course good proff
OMG - kill me... he is the most anal teacher I ever had - he makes u memorize graphs and numbers that u would never think u need to know. Course is interesting but I didn't enjoy him very much :(
